questions.question: What is the chemical formula of MIL-88B?
questions.answer: The chemical formula of MIL-88B is [Fe3(m3-O)(bdc)3X(H2O)2].

questions.question: What type of reactions does MIL-88B facilitate for organonitrile, alkyne, and alkene monomers?
questions.answer: MIL-88B facilitates [2 + 2 + 2] coordination templated cyclotrimerization reactions for organonitrile, alkyne, and alkene monomers.

questions.question: Is MIL-88B capable of catalyzing the trimerization reactions involving monomers with unsuitable coordination sites and molecular geometry?
questions.answer: No, MIL-88B is not capable of catalyzing the trimerization reactions involving monomers with unsuitable coordination sites and molecular geometry.

questions.question: What is the role of open metal sites in MIL-88B during the cyclotrimerization reactions?
questions.answer: The open metal sites in MIL-88B act as coordination templates to fix guest molecules in a configuration suitable for the cyclotrimerization reactions.

questions.question: What changes occur in the framework flexibility and gas adsorption performance of MIL-88B after the cyclotrimerization reactions?
questions.answer: After the cyclotrimerization reactions, the framework of MIL-88B becomes more rigid and its gas adsorption performance drastically improves.

questions.question: Can MIL-88B undergo significant solvent-induced breathing?
questions.answer: Yes, MIL-88B can undergo significant solvent-induced breathing.

questions.question: What is the topology of the coordination networks in the product crystals obtained by the cyclotrimerization reactions?
questions.answer: The coordination networks in the product crystals have a binodal (3,9)-connected nia-d topology.

questions.question: What is the effect of the CTC reaction on the unit-cell volume of MIL-88B?
questions.answer: The CTC reaction causes the unit-cell volume of MIL-88B to increase significantly.

questions.question: Is MIL-88B stable up to 400°C?
questions.answer: Yes, MIL-88B is stable up to 400°C.

questions.question: What is the role of hydrofluoric acid in the synthesis of large single crystals of MIL-88B?
questions.answer: Hydrofluoric acid is used to replace the conventionally used NaOH reactant in the synthesis of large single crystals of MIL-88B.
